paper.title: Facilitating Open Communication in Agent Systems: The InfoSleuth Infrastructure
paper.abstract: This paper addresses issues in developing open multiagent systems, in which it is easy to expand the functionality by adding new agents with new capabilities, and which facilitate interoperability with other agent systems. We argue that an open multiagent system should define the following support elements for agent :[48],"common set of speech acts to define the types of messages that an agent might send to another :[48],"common :[67],"service ontology by which the agents can describe their capabilities to each other, and reason about which agents have the capabilities needed to execute specific :[48],"common set of :[94],"prescriptive conversation policies to define the acceptable exchanges of messages between agents.
